abstract: In a show of regional pride, fans began using the phrase "Geaux Tigers!" in the 1990s to add local flavor to an otherwise standard cheer. The problem? The cheer makes no sense.
snippet: In a show of regional pride, fans began using the phrase "Geaux Tigers!" in the 1990s to add local flavor to an otherwise standard cheer. The problem? The cheer makes no sense.
lead_paragraph: BATON ROUGE, La. - Louisiana is famous for its Cajun French influences, its gumbo, crawfish étoufée and Mardi Gras. It is famous for laissez les bon temps rouler, as the saying goes, or letting the good times roll.

headline.main: Postcard From L.S.U.: Geaux? Just Go With It
